page.title: 06Rockwell Maudslay Gt.Alne
page.content: 259 people work at Rockwell Maudslay only 12 of those people are ladies and the other 247 are men because the things are too heavy for ladies to lift.Rockwell Maudslay is now situated in Great Alne but was originally built in Coventry but after continuous bombing moved in 1941.The Maudslay works were taken over by Rockwell International of Pittsburg, U.S.A.in 1972. The working hours are 08:00 to 16:30 and the lunch break of 12:30 to 13:00.The total amount of working hours a week is 39.There are 33 days holidays a year:the Easter week,Spring week,two weeks in summer and a week in September.They close down on Christmas Eve and go back on January 2nd. The firm make rear axles for buses and lorries.A change will be made,when imported Italian parts will be used.
